decks.notes: The primary strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of counter spells, removal spells, mill cards, and card advantage. By maintaining control of the board and hand, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win the game through attrition. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an additional layer of recursion and value to the deck, allowing for repeated use of powerful cards. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and grinding out a victory over the opponent.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cycling cards in order to trigger powerful effects such as Zenith Flare and Improbable Alliance. By cycling through your deck aggressively, you can overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to efficiently use your cycling cards to maintain card advantage and deal direct damage to your opponent, while also having the flexibility to switch gears and go for a quick finish with Zenith Flare.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive red creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Anax, Hardened in the Forge boost the damage output of the creatures, while Embercleave provides a powerful equipment option for increased damage. Snow lands and Faceless Haven offer additional utility and flexibility in the deck. Overall, the strategy is to apply constant pressure and finish the opponent off with a combination of creature attacks and burn spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to counter and remove opponent's threats while generating card advantage and gaining incremental advantage over time. It also aims to stabilize the board with enchantments and creature removals, develop its mana base, and eventually win the game with powerful finishers like Dream Trawler, Archon of Sun's Grace, and Skyclave Apparition. Yorion, Sky Nomad is used as a companion to maximize value by blinking permanents for additional benefits. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a longer game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cycling cards and cheap aggressive creatures to fill the graveyard with cards and trigger powerful effects like Zenith Flare and Irencrag Pyromancer. By cycling through the deck quickly, the player can maintain pressure on the opponent while also building towards a strong finish with Zenith Flare. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage, utilizing the cycling mechanic to ensure a consistent flow of options and threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing cycling cards to trigger abilities and deal damage, with Zenith Flare serving as a powerful finisher. Cards like Startling Development and Improbable Alliance help cycle through the deck quickly, while creatures like Drannith Stinger and Flourishing Fox provide additional damage output. The deck also includes cards like Rielle, the Everwise and Irencrag Pyromancer for card advantage and further damage potential. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a fast-paced, cycling-based strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and disrupting their strategy through a combination of counter spells, removal, and mill effects. By utilizing cards like Ruin Crab, Drown in the Loch, and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, the goal is to slowly chip away at the opponent's library while also maintaining control of the game through card advantage and disruption. Lurrus of the Dream-Den offers additional value by allowing the player to recast low-cost permanents from the graveyard, ensuring a steady stream of threats and answers throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using cards like Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum to ramp up quickly and play big threats like Vorinclex and Kiora Bests the Sea God. It uses a variety of control cards like Negate, Eliminate, and Shadows' Verdict to manage the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for more triggers. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing mill cards like Ruin Crab and enchantments like Into the Story to quickly diminish the opponent's library. It also includes control elements like counterspells and removal to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for consistent recursion of cheap creatures. The goal is to control the board, disrupt the opponent's plays, and ultimately win through milling the opponent's deck.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board with cards like The Akroan War and Claim the Firstborn, while also generating card advantage with Village Rites. Goldspan Dragon and Woe Strider provide excellent value, while aggressive threats like Bonecrusher Giant and Immersturm Predator pressure the opponent. Showdown of the Skalds and Shatterskull Smashing help maintain momentum, while the mana base ensures smooth casting of spells and creatures.

This Naya Aggro deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence through efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Clarion Spirit, and Giant Killer. By synergizing with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Jaspera Sentinel, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creature power and card advantage. Showdown of the Skalds and Felidar Retreat provide additional ways to pump up the board and create a wide battlefield. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility and flexibility to the deck's game plan.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive, low-cost creatures that can deal a lot of damage early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Embercleave and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell help increase the effectiveness of your creatures and ensure you can close out the game quickly. The deck also includes some control elements with Frost Bite to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the goal is to apply pressure and force your opponent to react defensively, allowing you to sneak in for the win.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up with cards like Cultivate and Emergent Ultimatum to set up powerful late-game plays. With a mix of counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win through card advantage and powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Valki, God of Lies. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through flickering permanents for extra ETB triggers.

This deck focuses on using powerful control spells and removal to dominate the board while ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven. It also includes Emergent Ultimatum to search for key win conditions like Alrund's Epiphany or Kiora Bests the Sea God. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra synergy. The deck aims to control the game through powerful spells and removal until it can bring out its big finishers to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful card advantage engines. It utilizes a variety of versatile cards to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also ramping into powerful late-game threats. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the Sultai Control deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats and generating card advantage to eventually overwhelm them with powerful spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and powerful spells to quickly defeat the opponent. It includes a mix of efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, alongside powerful spells like The Great Henge and Alrund's Epiphany to maintain pressure and generate advantage. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the deck's ability to deal consistent damage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's triple-color requirements while also providing flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient threats and powerful spells.
